I am working on putting it on space dock. But they working on website right now so...

Deltaglider XR1 been uploaded to SpaceDock. See the first post in this thread

**Edited <time datetime="2016-02-19T01:27:02Z" title="02/19/2016 01:27  AM" data-short="8 yr">February 19, 2016</time> by Redneck**

any news on the 1.1.2 update? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  

(and yeah, I know there is a rule now forbidding this kind of question, but since its been almost 4 months since the last post it got me wondering)

> 
> 
> On 6/5/2016 at 11:38 AM, JoseEduardo said:
> 
> 
> any news on the 1.1.2 update? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  
>   
> 
> (and yeah, I know there is a rule now forbidding this kind of question, but since its been almost 4 months since the last post it got me wondering)
> 

Yeah, [@Redneck](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/2030-redneck/), any development starting?

No its ok to ask I dont mind. I was awaiting them to fix/finish the wheels. We will see. I am thinking about doing a major texture redo also. But I have not forgotten and this project is not abandoned
You mean the landing leg glitch explosions on pad? From what i get, 1.1.3 fixed it, alongside many other nasty bugs. But you'd may want to check that out by yourself.

we are coming up on a 3 day weekend. lets see if i cant get you guys something to mess with.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-29T18:43:42Z" title="06/29/2016 06:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 29, 2016</time> by Redneck**

> 
> 
> On 6/29/2016 at 2:41 PM, Redneck said:
> 
> 
> we are coming up on a 3 day weekend. lets see if i cant get you guys something to mess with.
> 

Oooh will it be a functional deltaglider, or something new?
Well the deltaglider is already functional other then the landing gear

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Redneck said:
> 
> 
> Well the deltaglider is already functional other then the landing gear
> 

I meant fully updated, my bad.
well im also looking into how to maybe reduce the amount of dependent mods required. not sure im going to be able to pull this off without some custom code which i have no clue about

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Redneck said:
> 
> 
> well im also looking into how to maybe reduce the amount of dependent mods required. not sure im going to be able to pull this off without some custom code which i have no clue about
> 

Well what I can do for you is give you properly balanced <abbr title="Vertical Take-Off and Landing">VTOL</abbr> engines; if I make it front and rear engine parts, I can manually balance them, and then change the CFGs to reflect that.
all you have to do is use the thrust limiter on hover engines. cut the 2 rear ones to half and front to full

> 
> 
> 21 hours ago, Redneck said:
> 
> 
> all you have to do is use the thrust limiter on hover engines. cut the 2 rear ones to half and front to full
> 

I've done some testing and the perfect limits are 23.5% for the rear hover engines and 99% for front.

She lives again!

![wLY88mu.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/wLY88mu.jpg?1)

> 
> 
> 22 minutes ago, Redneck said:
> 
> 
> She lives again!
> 

Yessssss

I've gone through so many Frankenstein attempts to bring the Raven into KSP  
![1ihUbUg.png](http://i.imgur.com/1ihUbUg.png)

That is tremendously awesome man, keep it up!
that actually looks very good

I am looking to converting XR2 to <abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)"><abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)">FAR</abbr></abbr> mod. If successful and i like the results then Ill convert the Deltaglider also. Sound like a plan?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-05T14:18:30Z" title="07/05/2016 02:18  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 5, 2016</time> by Redneck**

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Redneck said:
> 
> 
> I am looking to converting XR2 to <abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)"><abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)"><abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)">FAR</abbr></abbr></abbr> mod. If successful and i like the results then Ill convert the Deltaglider also. Sound like a plan?
> 

Is the XR2 fully functional right now?

> 
> 
> 26 minutes ago, CommanderSpock said:
> 
> 
> Is the XR2 fully functional right now?
> 

ehhh! not really things to do are

1: get the <abbr title="Reaction Control System"><abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr></abbr> engines in

2: Animate docking port and assign hatches/ladders for EVA

3 cargo bay animations

4 landing gear (gear will be last due to learning curve involved and the time it will take to update the Deltaglider as well)

5 Retro engines and Rudders 1/2 working.(animations done)

6: Control flaps are in (no speed brake animation yet although I think using the <abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> drag model will actually make the speed brake work now and not just animated to look like it)

7: Need to get a basic IVA cockpit in (not necessarily the props but at least imported. Its using the Deltagliders now as a place holder)

8: hover engines and animations 

\*: any unforeseen glitches or hangups that slow me down (<abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)"><abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)">FAR</abbr></abbr> may be one. Dont anticipate it to be to bad) Any little touchups on the model such as normals maybe some bump maps for depth little stuff (I hope)

Right now the XR2 is flyable in a straight line and can get to orbit. Turning does work but results in a unrecoverable spin. <abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)"><abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)">FAR</abbr></abbr> should fix this problem and its really something Ive been wanting to get to work even when working on the deltaglider. The goal is to get these craft flying as smoothly and as maneuverable as can be made

To do so would actually slow down the progress. Its alot easier to Start KSP/ALT-F12/reload Database make changes Reload database rinse and repeat. But I do thank you for offering

a little update as seen in the picture with wing moved forward she flew perfectly

![lonhl1Y.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/lonhl1Y.png?1)so what does this mean? Well it means 2 things....

1: simply move the pivot point on the body in blender and re export that part of the model to unity. Moving the pivot point moves the Center of gravity

2: <abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)"><abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)"><abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)">FAR</abbr></abbr></abbr> research can be put on hold thus i can possibly release a "Testing" version a little early we shall see
